com.gnahraf.io.buffer

Class BufferOp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.io.buffer.BufferOp

  • public abstract class BufferOp
extends Object
    A unary buffer operation.
    Author:
    Babak

    • Field Detail

      • DUPLICATE

        public static final BufferOp DUPLICATE
        Duplicates the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns a new array.

      • DUPLICATE_INPLACE

        public static final BufferOp DUPLICATE_INPLACE
        Duplicates the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • SLICE

        public static final BufferOp SLICE
        Slices the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns a new array.

      • SLICE_INPLACE

        public static final BufferOp SLICE_INPLACE
        Slices the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • CLEAR

        public static final BufferOp CLEAR
        Clears the buffer. The input buffer is modified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • MARK

        public static final BufferOp MARK
        Marks the buffer. The input buffer is modified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • RESET

        public static final BufferOp RESET
        Resets the buffer. The input buffer is modified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • AS_READONLY

        public static final BufferOp AS_READONLY
        Creates a new read-only view of the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns a new array.

      • AS_READONLY_INPLACE

        public static final BufferOp AS_READONLY_INPLACE
        Creates a new read-only view of the buffer. The input buffer is unmodified. opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array.

      • ENSURE_READONLY

        public static final BufferOp ENSURE_READONLY
        Ensures the input buffer is read-only; if read-only, the input is returned; otherwise, a read-only view of the input is created and returned. The input buffer itself is unmodified.

        opAll(ByteBuffer[]) returns the input array, replacing any writable elements with read-only views of the same.

      • op

        public abstract ByteBuffer op(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Performs an operation on the given buffer, returning the result. The result may be the same instance (modified), or another instance.
        Parameters:
        buffer -
        Returns:
